}} 'Andrea de Cesaris' (born 31 May 1959) is an Italian former race car driver.
He started 208 Formula One Grands Prix but never won; his is the longest career
without a race victory. A string of accidents early in his career earned him the
nickname 'Andrea de Crasheris'. Though the nickname stuck, he became
a more reliable driver in his later career.

In 2005 and 2006 he competed in the Grand Prix Masters formula for retired
F1 drivers.
